tit.e: The Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
tit.cmt: "Fujiwara Hokke (Fujiwara Hoku Family)" -> "Northern House of the Fujiwara clan" に変更しました。

sen.j: 藤原北家（ふじわらほっけ）とは、右大臣藤原不比等の次男藤原房前を祖とする家系。
sen.e: Fujiwara Hokke is a family line whose originator is FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, the second son of minister of the right, FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
Fujiwara Hokke was a family line whose originator was FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, the second son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito, the minister of the right.
The Northern House of the Fujiwara clan was a family line whose originator was FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, the second son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito, the minister of the right.
sen.cmt: "Fujiwara Hokke" -> "The Northern House of the Fujiwara clan" に変更しました。

sen.e: One of Fujiwara four families.
It was one of four Fujiwara families.
It was one of four Fujiwara families.

sen.j: 藤原房前の邸宅が兄の藤原武智麻呂の邸宅よりも北に位置したことがこの名の由来。
sen.e: The name came from the fact that the house of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki was lolated north of the house of his elder brother, FUJIWARA no Muchimaro.
The name came from the fact that the house of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki was located north of the house of his elder brother, FUJIWARA no Muchimaro.
The name came from the fact that the house of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki was located north of the house of his elder brother, FUJIWARA no Muchimaro.

sen.j: 祖の房前は元正天皇朝で藤原四兄弟に先んじて参議に昇進すると、後に祖父藤原鎌足以来の内臣となり、元正天皇の側近として長屋王と政権を争った。
sen.e: The originator Fusasaki was promoted to councilar first among Fujiwara four brothers in the Gensho Emperor's era, later became the first Naishin (government post) since his grandfather, FUJIWARA no Kamatari, and fought as an aide close to Gensho Emperor for political power against Nagayao.

The originator, Fusasaki, was promoted to councilor first among four Fujiwara brothers during the era of Emperor Gensho, later became the first Naishin (government post) since his grandfather, FUJIWARA no Kamatari, and fought as an aide close to Emperor Gensho for political power against Nagayao.

The originator, Fusasaki, was promoted to councilor first among four Fujiwara brothers during the era of Emperor Gensho, later became the first Naishin (government post) since his grandfather, FUJIWARA no Kamatari, and fought as an aide close to the Emperor Gensho for political power against Nagayao.

sen.j: 聖武天皇朝になると、神亀6年（729年）長屋王の変により政権を掌握し、藤原四兄弟藤原四子政権でも中心人物として政権を主導したが、天平9年（737年）の天然痘蔓延により他の兄弟とともに病没してしまう。
sen.e: In the Shomu Emperor's era, Fusasaki gained political power after Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) in 729, and controlled the political power as a pivotal figure particulary among the political power by Fujiwara four brothers, Fujiwara four children, but he died together wit other brothers due to the spread of smallpox.

During the era of Emperor Shomu, Fusasaki gained political power after the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) in 729 and controlled the political power as a pivotal figure, particularly among the political power by the four Fujiwara brothers, but he died together with other brothers due to the spread of smallpox.

During the era of Emperor Shomu, Fusasaki gained political power after the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) in 729 and controlled the political power as a pivotal figure, particularly among the political power by the four Fujiwara brothers, but he died in 737 together with other brothers due to the spread of smallpox.

sen.j: その後奈良時代後期～平安時代初期にかけては、光仁天皇朝で房前の子である藤原永手・藤原魚名が左大臣となるも、永手の嫡男藤原家依は早逝し、魚名は氷上川継の乱に連座して失脚したこともあり、藤原南家・藤原式家に押されがちの状態にあった。
sen.e: Thereafter, from the Late Nara era through the Early Heian era, Fujiwara Hokke had been losing ground by Fujiwara Nanke (Fujiwara Nan Family) and Fujiwara-shiki Family partly because although Fusasaki's sons, FUJIWARA no Nagate and FUJIWARA no Uona became minister of the left in the Konin Emperor's era, Nagate's heir, FUJIWARA no Oyori died young and Uona was involved in HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War to fall from power.

Thereafter, from the late Nara period through the early Heian period Fujiwara Hokke had been losing ground to the Fujiwara Nanke (the Fujiwara Nan Family) and Fujiwara-shiki Family, partly because although Fusasaki's sons, FUJIWARA no Nagate and FUJIWARA no Uona, became ministers of the left in the era of Emperor Konin, Nagate's heir, FUJIWARA no Oyori, died young and Uona was involved in HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's war, whereupon he fell from power.

Thereafter, from the late Nara period through the early Heian period the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan had been losing ground to the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan and the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, partly because although Fusasaki's sons, FUJIWARA no Nagate and FUJIWARA no Uona, became ministers of the left in the era of Emperor Konin, Nagate's heir, FUJIWARA no Oyori, died young and Uona was involved in HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's war, whereupon he fell from power.
sen.cmt: "Fujiwara Hokke" -> "Northern House of the Fujiwara clan"、"Fujiwara Nanke" -> "Southern House of the Fujiwara clan"、"Fujiwara-shiki Family" -> "Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan" を変更しました。

sen.j: しかしながら、平城天皇朝以降、大同2年（807年）の伊予親王事件にて南家、弘仁元年（810年）の薬子の変にて式家の勢力が衰えると、嵯峨天皇の信任を得た藤原冬嗣が急速に台頭し他家を圧倒するようになった。
sen.e: However, since the Heijo Emperor's era, FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu who won confidence of Saga Emperor had rapidly gained power and started to overwhelm other families when Nan Family lost its power after Iyo Shinno no Hen (Conspiracy of Iyo Imperial Prince) in 807 and Shiki Family lost its power after Kusuko no Hen Conspiracy in 810.

However, since the era of Emperor Heijo, FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu (who had won the confidence of Emperor Saga) had rapidly gained power and started to overwhelm other families when the Nan Family lost its power after the Iyo Shinno no Hen (Conspiracy of Imperial Prince Iyo) of 807, and the Shiki Family lost its power after the Kusuko no Hen Conspiracy of 810.

However, since the era of Emperor Heijo, FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu (who had won the confidence of Emperor Saga) had rapidly gained power and started to overwhelm other families when the Southern House lost its power after the Iyo Shinno no Hen (Conspiracy of Imperial Prince Iyo) of 807, and the Ceremonial House lost its power after the Kusuko no Hen Conspiracy of 810.
sen.cmt: "Nan Family" -> "Southern House"、"Shiki Family" -> "Ceremonial House" に変更しました。

sen.j: さらに、冬嗣（文徳天皇）・藤原良房（清和天皇）・藤原基経（朱雀天皇・村上天皇）と北家嫡流が三代に亘って天皇の外祖父となり、同家の優勢を確立した。
sen.e: Moreover, the main branch of the Hoku Family became maternal grandfather over three generations, i.e., Fuyutsugu (Montoku Emperor), FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa (Seiwa Emperor), and FUJIWARA no Mototsune (Suzaku Emperor and Murakami Emperor), whereby the predominance of the Hoku Family was established.

Moreover, the main branch of the Hoku Family became maternal grandfather over three generations--Fuyutsugu (Emperor Montoku), FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa (Emperor Seiwa) and FUJIWARA no Mototsune (Emperor Suzaku and Emperor Murakami)--whereby the predominance of the Hoku Family was established.

Moreover, the main branch of the Northern House became maternal grandfather over three generations--Fuyutsugu (Emperor Montoku), FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa (Emperor Seiwa) and FUJIWARA no Mototsune (Emperor Suzaku and Emperor Murakami)--whereby the predominance of the Northern House was established.
sen.cmt: "Hoku Family" -> "Northern House" に変更しました。

sen.j: 以後、北家嫡流が藤氏長者となり、摂政・関白もこの系統から輩出することになった。
sen.e: Since then, the main branch of the Hoku Family became the leader of Toshi/Toji, and produced regents and chief advisors to the Emperor.
Subsequently, the main branch of the Hoku Family became the leader of Toshi/Toji, and produced regents and chief advisors to the Emperor.
Subsequently, the main branch of the Northern House became the leader of Toshi/Toji, and produced regents and chief advisors to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: "Hoku Family" -> "Northern House" に変更しました。

sen.j: 後に、藤原道長・藤原頼通の代で藤原摂関政治の全盛を極める。
sen.e: Later, in the generations of FUJIWARA no Michinaga and FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, Fujiwara's Sekkan (regent to the emperor) government reached full bloom.
Later, in the generations of FUJIWARA no Michinaga and FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, the government of Fujiwara's Sekkan (regent to the Emperor) reached full bloom.
Later, in the generations of FUJIWARA no Michinaga and FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, the government of Fujiwara's Sekkan (regent to the Emperor) reached full bloom.

sen.j: 道長・頼通の子孫は摂家を輩出し公家の最高家格を独占するに至った。
sen.e: The descendant of Michinaga and Yorimichi produced Sekke (Setsu Family) to finally dominate the highest rank of Kakaku (Family status) among court noble.
The descendant of Michinaga and Yorimichi produced Sekke (the Setsu Family) to finally dominate the highest rank of kakaku (family status) among the court nobility.
The descendant of Michinaga and Yorimichi produced Sekke (the Setsu Family) to finally dominate the highest rank of kakaku (family status) among the court nobility.

sen.j: また、他の藤原姓の堂上家もほとんどが北家の子孫である。
sen.e: Most of the Dojo Family that is another family line using Fujiwara cognomen are also descendant of the Hoku Family.
Most of the Dojo Family, which is another family line that used the Fujiwara cognomen, also descended from the Hoku Family.
Most of the Dojo Family, which is another family line that used the Fujiwara cognomen, also descended from the Northern House.
sen.cmt: "Hoku Family" -> "Northern House" に変更しました。

sen.j: 派生氏族は公家ばかりではなく、藤原道兼宇都宮氏・小田氏、藤原長家那須氏、勧修寺流上杉氏、藤原山蔭伊達氏、藤原利仁斎藤氏・加藤氏、藤原秀郷奥州藤原氏・足利氏 (藤原氏)・小山氏・結城氏・佐野氏・小野崎氏など、主に関東・北陸・東北を中心に活躍した多数の武家が藤原北家の末裔と称した。
sen.e: The derivative clan is not only limited to court noble but also include a large number of samurai families who had influence mainly in Kanto, Hokuriku, and Tohoku and claimed to be descendant of Fujiwara Hokke, such as FUJIWARA no Michikane-Utsunomiya clan, Oda clan, FUJIWARA no Nagaie-Nasu clan, Uesugi clan of Kajuji group, Fujiwara-Yamakage-Date clan, FUJIWARA no Toshihito-Saito clan, Kato clan, FUJIWARA no Hidesato-Oshu Fujiwara clan, Ashikaga clan (Fujiwara clan), Oyama clan, Yuki clan, Sano clan, and Onosaki clan.

The derivative clan was not merely limited to court nobility but also included a large number of samurai families that had influence mainly in Kanto, Hokuriku and Tohoku, claiming to be descended from Fujiwara Hokke--such as the FUJIWARA no Michikane-Utsunomiya clan, the Oda clan, the FUJIWARA no Nagaie-Nasu clan, the Uesugi clan of the Kajuji group, the Fujiwara-Yamakage-Date clan, the FUJIWARA no Toshihito-Saito clan, the Kato clan, the FUJIWARA no Hidesato-Oshu Fujiwara clan, the Ashikaga clan (Fujiwara clan), the Oyama clan, the Yuki clan, the Sano clan and the Onosaki clan.

The derivative clan was not merely limited to court nobility but also included a large number of samurai families that had influence mainly in Kanto, Hokuriku and Tohoku, claiming to be descended from the Northern House--such as the FUJIWARA no Michikane-Utsunomiya clan, the Oda clan, the FUJIWARA no Nagaie-Nasu clan, the Uesugi clan of the Kajuji group, the Fujiwara-Yamakage-Date clan, the FUJIWARA no Toshihito-Saito clan, the Kato clan, the FUJIWARA no Hidesato-Oshu Fujiwara clan, the Ashikaga clan (the Fujiwara clan), the Oyama clan, the Yuki clan, the Sano clan and the Onosaki clan.
sen.cmt: "the" を挿入しました。"Fujiwara Hokke" -> "the Northern House" に変更しました。

sen.j: 藤原四家の中では遅く花開いた一族だが、結果として藤原四家の中でも最も根を拡げることになった一族である。
sen.e: Although Fujiwara Hokke is a family that flourished last among the Fujiwara four families, Fujiwara Hokke is the family that spread out the most roots among the Fujiwara four families as a result.
Although the Fujiwara Hokke Family was the last of the four Fujiwara families to successfully flourish, as a result it spread the most extensive roots among the four Fujiwara families.
Although the Northern House was the last of the four Fujiwara families to successfully flourish, as a result it spread the most extensive roots among the four Fujiwara families.
